questions.question: When you're in a new situation, what's the first thing you tend to look for?

answers.text: What needs to get done first?
How is everyone feeling?
Let me get a sense of what's going on.
What can I jump into right away?

questions.question: When someone gives you instructions, how do you usually approach them?

answers.text: I follow the steps exactly.
I ask questions to make sure I understand.
I watch once, then match the pace.
I learn by trying it hands-on.

questions.question: When things suddenly get busy or chaotic, what tends to happen in your mind?

answers.text: I immediately sort out what needs attention first.
I stay tuned into how everyone around me is feeling.
I naturally slow down internally and stay steady.
I actually get energized and move faster.

questions.question: When someone around you seems unhappy or frustrated, what’s your natural first instinct?

answers.text: I think through what might have gone wrong and how to fix it quickly.
I focus on how they're feeling and what they emotionally need.
I stay calm and steady until I know the best way to respond.
I try to lighten the mood or shift the energy.

questions.question: When you’re learning a new job or skill, what helps you feel confident the quickest?

answers.text: Seeing the whole process mapped out.
Talking it through or asking questions.
Watching someone experienced do it first.
Jumping in and trying it myself.
